Section (Ooma)","type":"Customer Stories Article","copy":"[Ooma](https://www.ooma.com/ \\"Ooma\\") creates powerful connected experiences for businesses, with robust and reliable unified communications tailored to individual business needs. With Telnyx, Ooma can provide voice and messaging solutions that are highly customizable, easy to integrate and globally scalable.\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n## __A global business deserves a global network__\\nServing businesses of all sizes, Ooma operates globally, with major hubs in Chicago, San Jose, Vancouver, Sydney, London and more. When evaluating providers, it wasn’t enough for a carrier to have infrastructure in a single location. They demanded a global network to extend their footprint and provide the best possible call quality to users.\\n\\nTelnyx has physical points of presence in key locations around the world. Ooma fully leverages this global network through AnchorSite™ — a Telnyx feature that enables users to choose the location at which they want to anchor their call media. The benefit? Shorter network paths and consistently lower latency. \\n\\n“With Telnyx, we’re able to get coverage all over the world through one API and one point of contact,” said Dayton Turner, Ooma VP of Enterprise Product. “Telnyx had the technology and feature set we needed, but understanding the care that went into prioritizing network architecture made us confident we were making the right decision.”\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n## __Why use four providers when you can use one?__\\nPrior to switching to Telnyx, Ooma was using multiple providers for numbering, voice and messaging services. \\n\\n“The problem was managing multiple relationships with different carriers, with different feature sets and APIs … or no APIs at all,” said Turner.\\n\\nWith Telnyx, they were able to cut the number of providers down from four to one, streamlining carrier operations into one easily manageable relationship. And that means they’re not wasting valuable time and resources so they can “move faster, do a better job and spend less time doing it.”\\n\\nIt’s no surprise that consolidating carriers has resulted in significant cost savings. By switching to Telnyx, Ooma has reduced costs by around 30%. This means they can scale their business more efficiently, passing on the benefits to their users.\\n\\nHowever, some of the added consolidation benefits were more surprising, including better quality reporting and easy access to features that were previously inaccessible or awkward to manage. \\n\\n“Having a dedicated carrier opened up new opportunities for us. We had to email our previous SMS provider’s customer support for numbers. We’re now fully integrated with the Telnyx API, which means our customers can search for, port or buy numbers seamlessly via our portal — a much better overall experience.”\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n## __Easy integration, scalability and support__\\nTo deliver a global, unified communications solution, Ooma needed deep integration with their provider, particularly for seamless number purchasing and fast porting. Using Telnyx APIs, they’re also able to take advantage of messaging, fax, caller ID and LRN lookups. \\n\\n“On top of good network quality, Telnyx has the API, portal and documentation,” said Turner. “That means we can simply add features when we need to.”\\n\\nAnd it’s impossible to overestimate the importance of good support when it comes to voice services, which Turner gives a 10/10.\\n\\n“When we need something, Telnyx figures it out. That’s a nice peace of mind to Control FAQs","type":"Deep Dive","deepDiveLayout":"Faq","deepDiveColorTheme":"Light Theme","heading":"Frequently Asked Questions","copy":"__What is a voice API?__ \\u003cbr /\\u003e\\nA [voice \\u003cabbr title=\\"Application Programming Interface\\"\\u003eAPI\\u003c/abbr\\u003e](https://telnyx.com/resources/what-is-voice-api) is a tool that software developers use to make and receive phone calls using an Application Programming Interface (API). A voice API connects internet-based applications to the Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN).\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n__How do I build with the Telnyx voice API?__ \\u003cbr /\\u003e\\nTo get started, [sign up](https://telnyx.com/sign-up) for a Portal account, then follow the 4 remaining steps in our [quickstart guide](https://developers.telnyx.com/docs/v2/call-control/quickstart) to create an application, buy a number, assign it to your app and create an outbound voice profile. Then, use our SDKs to start building.\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n__Can I record calls with Call Control?__ \\u003cbr /\\u003e\\nYes, you can use the Telnyx [voice API](https://telnyx.com/resources/what-is-voice-api) to record calls using the record_start command. You’ll find code snippets to help you do this quickly and easily in our [developer center](https://developers.telnyx.com/docs/api/v2/call-control/Call-Commands).\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n__Does Telnyx offer text-to-speech capabilities?__ \\u003cbr /\\u003e\\nAbsolutely. Text-to-speech allows you to convert text to speech and play it back on the call. We leverage Amazon Polly to provide a conversational experience, available across 29 languages and accents. You can find out how to use the speak_text command in our [developer center](https://developers.telnyx.com/docs/api/v2/call-control/Call-Commands#CallControlSpeak).\\n","secondaryCopy":"__How much does Call Control cost?__ \\u003cbr /\\u003e\\nYou can find the latest pricing for Call Control [here](https://telnyx.com/pricing/call-control). Telnyx offers even greater discounts as you scale, or when you’re ready to commit to monthly usage—[talk to our sales team](https://telnyx.com/contact-us) about custom pricing.\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n__Can I use XML code with the Telnyx voice API?__ \\u003cbr /\\u003e\\nYou can! We’ve developed a tool called [TeXML Translator](https://telnyx.com/texml-translator) to make it easy for you to use your XML based applications with the Telnyx voice API. Follow the [TeXML setup guide](https://developers.telnyx.com/docs/v2/call-control/texml-setup) in our developer center to get started.\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n__What use-cases does the Telnyx voice API support?__ \\u003cbr /\\u003e\\nYou can build a range of different applications using the Telnyx voice API—these include [call tracking](https://telnyx.com/use-cases/call-tracking), [cloud IVR](https://telnyx.com/use-cases/cloud-ivr), [contact center](https://telnyx.com/use-cases/contact-center) and conference calling, to name a few.\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n__What’s the difference between calls made via voice API and WebRTC?__ \\u003cbr /\\u003e\\nWhile phone calls made using a voice API can be powered over the internet, they also rely on a VoIP network to be completed. WebRTC calls are solely focused on browser-based communication. Learn more about [Telnyx’s WebRTC solution](https://telnyx.com/products/webrtc).","items":[{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"3Ttkn1IqiihgkTi9k14i0F"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"2Ly21FQVmV8QgaEumzgdca"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"5RZPdXnzesoxX8DfnrYeQr"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"6hTUFqVdKHf38DaHwaSyTO"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"73X3EwccrN8axjmTg1AoBS"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"77IKTLKvFXdgkXSwjmK6UC"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"3K2g6C2m2Vg4pKBNi3xTtv"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"4ZRjVjVAw8wLUWaMqzMIIQ"}}],"topSpacing":"Normal","bottomSpacing":"Large"}}],"customFields":{}}}}},{"metadata":{"tags":[]},"sys":{"space":{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Space","id":"taysl255dolk"}},"id":"1D7hfN2tKPvffj7M047xPW","type":"Entry","createdAt":"2020-07-29T01:38:18.082Z","updatedAt":"2021-06-08T19:54:20.375Z","environment":{"sys":{"id":"master","type":"Link","linkType":"Environment"}},"revision":2,"contentType":{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"ContentType","id":"pageSectionItem"}},"locale":"en-US"},"fields":{"cmsTitle":"Elastic SIP Trunking?__\\u003cbr\\u003e\\nSIP Trunking, put simply, is a means of operating phone systems over the internet, instead of using a traditional phone line. Learn more about how SIP trunking can transform your business communications on our [Resource Center](https://telnyx.com/resources/sip-trunking-explained \\"SIP Trunking Explained: What Is It and How Can It Transform Your Communications? | Telnyx\\").\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n__What Are the Benefits of SIP Trunking?__\\u003cbr\\u003e\\nSIP Trunking has a huge range of benefits over traditional business telephony systems, including [scalability](https://telnyx.com/resources/sip-trunking-capacity-private-network \\"Building Private IP Network SIP Trunks for Scalability | Telnyx\\"), [cost savings](https://telnyx.com/resources/new-and-improved-price-for-outbound-calls \\"New and Improved Price for Outbound Calls | Telnyx\\") and [configurability](https://telnyx.com/use-cases/mission-control \\"Mission Control Portal | Telnyx\\"). Find out more about what SIP trunking can do for you on our [Resource Center](https://telnyx.com/resources/sip-trunking-explained \\"SIP Trunking Explained: What Is It and How Can It Transform Your Communications?\\").\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n__How Much Does SIP Trunking Cost?__\\u003cbr\\u003e\\nSIP trunking is cheaper than traditional business phone systems. We offer pay-as-you-go pricing with automatic volume discounts as you scale. Find out more with an in-depth breakdown of our [pricing](https://telnyx.com/pricing/elastic-sip/  \\"Pricing - Elastic SIP Trunking | Telnyx\\"), or [talk to an expert](https://telnyx.com/contact-us \\"Talk to Us | Telnyx\\") to get a custom quote.\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n","secondaryCopy":"__How Can I Get Started With SIP Trunking?__\\u003cbr\\u003e\\nGetting set up couldn'**t be easier. Just [sign up](https://telnyx.com/sign-up \\"Sign Up | Telnyx\\") for an account, then follow one of our [Bring Your Own Carrier](https://telnyx.com/bring-your-own-carrier \\"Bring Your Own Carrier | Telnyx\\") guides to integrate with your PBX or softphone client.\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n__How Many SIP Trunks Do I Need?__\\u003cbr\\u003e\\nOne SIP trunk is all your business needs to run all of your communications. Once your trunk is set up, you can scale up or down concurrent call capacity by adding or removing usage [channels](https://telnyx.com/resources/channel-billing-what-it-is-and-why-its-important \\"Channel Billing: What It Is and Why It**'s Important\\"), or choose pay-per-minute billing for unlimited concurrent inbound call capacity.\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n__How Do I Configure SIP Trunks?__\\u003cbr\\u003e\\nYou can configure, monitor and manage your SIP trunks through the Telnyx [Mission Control Portal](https://telnyx.com/use-cases/mission-control \\"Mission Control Portal | Telnyx\\"). For large-scale or automated configuration, you can also leverage the [Telnyx API](https://developers.telnyx.com/docs \\"API Documentation | Telnyx\\") to configure your communications programmatically. FAQs (SMS)","type":"Deep Dive","deepDiveLayout":"Faq","deepDiveColorTheme":"Light Theme","heading":"Frequently Asked Questions","copy":"### What is an SMS API?\\nAn [SMS API](https://telnyx.com/resources/sms-api-explained) is a software interface that allows developers to build code that can send and receive SMS messages using an Application Programming Interface (API).\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n### How Do I get started with the Telnyx SMS API?\\nTo get started, [sign up for a Portal account](https://portal.telnyx.com/#/login/sign-in), then follow the steps in our [quickstart guide](https://developers.telnyx.com/docs/v2/messaging/quickstarts/portal-setup) to buy an SMS-enabled number, create a messaging profile and start sending text messages.\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n### How does an SMS API work?\\nAn [SMS API](https://telnyx.com/resources/sms-api-explained) works by allowing developers to simply connect our external SMS interface into your existing infrastructure, to enable a smooth passing of commands and responses from your application to the interface and back for sending and receiving of SMS anywhere in the world.\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n### How much does SMS cost using the Telnyx API?\\nTelnyx offers market-leading prices for feature-rich SMS, starting at just $0.0025 to send an SMS on a local number, and they’re free to receive. You can find detailed pricing information [here](https://telnyx.com/pricing/messaging). Telnyx also offers even greater discounts as you scale, or when you’re ready to commit to monthly usage—[talk to our sales team](https://telnyx.com/contact-us) about your specific needs.\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n### Does Telnyx provide SDKs?\\nYes, we provide [SDKs](https://developers.telnyx.com/docs/api/v2/overview) in Python, Java, Node, Ruby, .NET and PHP, with more coming soon. These API wrappers help make cut down integration, so you can get to market faster.\\n","secondaryCopy":"### Is there support for sending bulk SMS?\\nTelnyx has the ability to scale with you and supports large scale and broadcast messaging, just make sure your messages follow the [Telnyx Acceptable Use Policy](https://support.telnyx.com/en/articles/1310359-acceptable-use-policy-for-messaging).\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n### Can I send images or videos via the Telnyx SMS API?\\nYes, Telnyx supports [rich media texting (MMS)](https://telnyx.com/products/mms-api), so you can send images, gifs or videos as needed.\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n### Can I send texts via short code on the Telnyx SMS API?\\nAbsolutely, shortcodes are perfect for sending and receiving high volume texts. You can find more information about [Telnyx shortcode SMS](https://telnyx.com/products/sms-short-code) here. \\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n### What is an alphanumeric sender ID?\\nAn [alphanumeric sender ID](https://developers.telnyx.com/docs/v2/messaging/features/alpha-sender-id) lets you send messages using a custom ID constructed from a combination of alpha (a-z, A-Z) and numeric (0-9) characters as well as spaces. This makes the sender identifiable to the receiver, as companies can set their brand name as the ID (e.g., TELNYX). It**'s commonly used for sending one-way text messages, as the person receiving the message will be unable to reply with an Alphanumeric Sender ID.\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n### What use-cases does the Telnyx SMS API support?\\nYou integrate messaging into a range of different applications Telnyx voice API—these include [two-factor authentication](https://telnyx.com/use-cases/two-factor-authentication), [SMS marketing](https://telnyx.com/use-cases/sms-marketing), political campaigns, [customer support](https://telnyx.com/use-cases/sms-customer-support) and many more.\\n","items":[{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"4ULfOi8kRXi9iIKFbxADAh"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"5ToZeC2Oen7Zpv2Fqwie7A"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"RKuOSeWs4QG0aGKnXfUvC"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"rW2itva4eGL7jVKVfeebz"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"4cakfGM8yDFFrcKkd9eLZb"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"12aK8W0oxX74kDCUCMa8mv"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"2Vfr5dik3GSrv2gTK6CIlu"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"41jtFb5KQGKkUiZ2t50NT9"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"52EhYk8j10GKybzchFF3zL"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"6BtjmujAO7b9tL0cMY7VNy"}}],"topSpacing":"Normal"}}],"customFields":{}}}}},{"metadata":{"tags":[]},"sys":{"space":{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Space","id":"taysl255dolk"}},"id":"3gU1OQIfQmL7IdIqGM5aUV","type":"Entry","createdAt":"2022-08-19T15:31:39.728Z","updatedAt":"2022-08-19T15:32:10.138Z","environment":{"sys":{"id":"master","type":"Link","linkType":"Environment"}},"revision":2,"contentType":{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"ContentType","id":"pageSectionItem"}},"locale":"en-US"},"fields":{"cmsTitle":"International Section (Ooma)","type":"Customer Stories Article","copy":"[Ooma](https://www.ooma.com/ \\"Ooma\\") creates powerful connected experiences for businesses, with robust and reliable unified communications tailored to individual business needs. With Telnyx, Ooma can provide voice and messaging solutions that are highly customizable, easy to integrate and globally scalable.\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n## __A global business deserves a global network__\\nServing businesses of all sizes, Ooma operates globally, with major hubs in Chicago, San Jose, Vancouver, Sydney, London and more. When evaluating providers, it wasn’t enough for a carrier to have infrastructure in a single location. They demanded a global network to extend their footprint and provide the best possible call quality to users.\\n\\nTelnyx has physical points of presence in key locations around the world. Ooma fully leverages this global network through AnchorSite™ — a Telnyx feature that enables users to choose the location at which they want to anchor their call media. The benefit? Shorter network paths and consistently lower latency. \\n\\n“With Telnyx, we’re able to get coverage all over the world through one API and one point of contact,” said Dayton Turner, Ooma VP of Enterprise Product. “Telnyx had the technology and feature set we needed, but understanding the care that went into prioritizing network architecture made us confident we were making the right decision.”\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n## __Why use four providers when you can use one?__\\nPrior to switching to Telnyx, Ooma was using multiple providers for numbering, voice and messaging services. \\n\\n“The problem was managing multiple relationships with different carriers, with different feature sets and APIs … or no APIs at all,” said Turner.\\n\\nWith Telnyx, they were able to cut the number of providers down from four to one, streamlining carrier operations into one easily manageable relationship. And that means they’re not wasting valuable time and resources so they can “move faster, do a better job and spend less time doing it.”\\n\\nIt’s no surprise that consolidating carriers has resulted in significant cost savings. By switching to Telnyx, Ooma has reduced costs by around 30%. This means they can scale their business more efficiently, passing on the benefits to their users.\\n\\nHowever, some of the added consolidation benefits were more surprising, including better quality reporting and easy access to features that were previously inaccessible or awkward to manage. \\n\\n“Having a dedicated carrier opened up new opportunities for us. We had to email our previous SMS provider’s customer support for numbers. We’re now fully integrated with the Telnyx API, which means our customers can search for, port or buy numbers seamlessly via our portal — a much better overall experience.”\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n## __Easy integration, scalability and support__\\nTo deliver a global, unified communications solution, Ooma needed deep integration with their provider, particularly for seamless number purchasing and fast porting. Using Telnyx APIs, they’re also able to take advantage of messaging, fax, caller ID and LRN lookups. \\n\\n“On top of good network quality, Telnyx has the API, portal and documentation,” said Turner. “That means we can simply add features when we need to.”\\n\\nAnd it’s impossible to overestimate the importance of good support when it comes to voice services, which Turner gives a 10/10.\\n\\n“When we need something, Telnyx figures it out. That’s a nice peace of mind to have.”","items":[{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"2DNaff9pwYMLluIpixJknt"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"6CTS9UaFqOS7C5HGdqWgVx"}}]}},{"metadata":{"tags":[]},"sys":{"space":{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Space","id":"taysl255dolk"}},"id":"6Bi96vGtObmfDSACgz4hW9","type":"Entry","createdAt":"2019-12-10T18:05:31.498Z","updatedAt":"2019-12-10T18:05:31.498Z","environment":{"sys":{"id":"master","type":"Link","linkType":"Environment"}},"revision":1,"contentType":{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"ContentType","id":"pageSection"}},"locale":"en-US"},"fields":{"title":"Customer Section (Replicant)","type":"Customer Stories Article","copy":"When [Replicant](https://www.replicant.com/) surveyed the market of Voice API providers, they were looking for one thing: speed. The San Francisco company’s conversational AI technology creates authentic, natural, automated interactions with customers, without lag, latency, or interruption.\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\nWatch the video interview with Replicant CTO and co-founder Benjamin Gleitzman and Telnyx Head of Customer Success Mark Morse to learn how Telnyx sits at the core of this technology:\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n\\u003cstyle\\u003e\\n  .videoWrapper {\\n  position: relative;\\n  padding-bottom: 56.25%; /* 16:9 */\\n  height: 0;\\n}\\n.videoWrapper iframe {\\n  position: absolute;\\n  top: 0;\\n  left: 0;\\n  width: 100%;\\n  height: 100%;\\n}\\n  \\u003c/style\\u003e\\n  \\u003cdiv class=\\"videoWrapper\\"\\u003e\\n\\u003ciframe src=\\"https://player.vimeo.com/video/460344018\\" width=\\"640\\" height=\\"360\\" frameborder=\\"0\\" allow=\\"autoplay; fullscreen\\" allowfullscreen\\u003e\\u003c/iframe\\u003e\\n  \\u003c/div\\u003e\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n## __Low-Latency Media Access enables Human-Like Conversational AI__\\n\\nTo create a realistic conversational AI experience, Replicant demands consistently low “talk-time” latency (the time from when the user stops speaking to when the bot responds). Acceptable latency for their AI is one second or less.\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\nBut achieving this low latency was a challenge, as most providers could only reduce latency to three seconds. Other AI platforms mask this kind of delayed response with “human” noises (e.g., typing sounds or audible “um” sounds), but Replicant wanted to be honest and upfront with their customers.\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n“People notice when you’re trying to cover up latency, and the call turns into a sluggish lecture instead of a conversation,” said Gleitzman. “It’s very important that we’re genuine and honest with our customers. It’s one of the reasons we focus on latency and engineer our systems to save every millisecond we can. Because we’re able to get latency down to the level we want with Telnyx, we don’t have to bend the truth with our customers like some of our competitors.”\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\nReplicant has seen a huge speed boost since switching to Telnyx, cutting talk-time latency from more than 3 seconds to under 1 second by leveraging the high-speed Telnyx [Programmable Voice API](/products/voice-api) for real-time media packet access, and [Virtual Cross Connects](/products/virtual-cross-connects) to link their cloud infrastructure directly to [Telnyx'**s multi-cloud network](/solutions/global-ip-network). “We did a survey of the scene, and, in many cases, Telnyx was the fastest provider that was there on the market.”\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n## __Carrier-Grade Quality provides High Availability and Peace-of-Mind__\\n\\nIn providing mission-critical contact center technology to their customers, Replicant can’t afford downtime or call audio issues. With Telnyx, reliability worries are a thing of the past.\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\nReplicant [recently raised $27M in Series A financing](https://www.forbes.com/sites/kenrickcai/2020/09/10/replicant-series-a-call-center-voice-ai/ \\"Replicant Raises $27 Million To Propel Its Voice AI For Customer Service Phone Calls\\"), and serves a growing base of enterprise customers. With this growth, Gleitzman says, “our demands for an always-on, reliable service have really increased.” The company sought a provider with a global, redundant network to ensure this always-on service. “I’m impressed with the steps Telnyx has taken to ensure we never go down,” said Gleiztman. “In places where there’s really no way to mitigate without switching over to another region or another data center, Telnyx has created that ability for us.”\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n## __Easy Scalability enables Rapid Deployment and Growth__\\n\\nAs a fast-growing software company, Replicant sought a telephony partner who could keep pace with their development cycles and accelerate their onboarding of new customers.\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n“Replicant can be on the phone now, and taking 100% of call center traffic in days - not weeks or months, which may happen with other players who are out there on the market,” said Gleiztman, citing continuous improvements to the Telnyx telephony engine alongside improvements to the company’s AI models as core drivers of this rapid onboarding ability. “We’ve ramped from hundreds to hundreds of thousands of calls per day with customers without experiencing any issues from Telnyx - it’s really been quite seamless.”\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n## __Flexible Voice APIs and AI Combine for the Contact Center of the Future__\\n\\nMore than just delivering low-latency chatbots, Replicant has ambitions to revolutionize an entire industry - in Gleiztman’s words, “Replicant powers the world’s first autonomous contact center.”\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\nThis bold claim speaks to a dramatic shift in how the world thinks about contact center solutions, especially as the COVID-19 crisis placed unprecedented demands on contact centers across the globe. “I think everyone took a really hard look at their business in February and March as things were beginning to shut down. I believe our technology, in partnership with Telnyx as a telephony provider, is exactly what today’s unpredictable world needs \\\\[...\\\\] We’re giving companies the ability to deliver elastic capacity, address shifting customer demand, scale-up, scale-down, and, not only handle but actually fully triage, support and answer call flows, so you get an always-on customer service.”\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\n## __Cost Savings Matter, Especially at Scale__\\n\\nWith every business decision, price is always an important factor. By switching to Telnyx, Replicant reduced voice costs from 7 cents to 1 cent per minute — that’s an 86% reduction. The substantial cost difference means Replicant can offer more competitive pricing and scale efficiently without having to worry about spiraling costs.\\u003cbr\\u003e\\n\\u003cbr\\u003e","items":[{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"r4z1zNyjp3CsxWNvQCDAm"}},{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Entry","id":"13k7BhRdiD0iZemFtp7bmW"}}]}},{"metadata":{"tags":[]},"sys":{"space":{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"Space","id":"taysl255dolk"}},"id":"4HZXWPt6Jygos5aiScgIXv","type":"Entry","createdAt":"2019-12-05T20:51:13.154Z","updatedAt":"2019-12-05T20:51:13.154Z","environment":{"sys":{"id":"master","type":"Link","linkType":"Environment"}},"revision":1,"contentType":{"sys":{"type":"Link","linkType":"ContentType","id":"pageSection"}},"locale":"en-US"},"fields":{"title":"Customer
